meanings.definition: A person authorized to act on behalf of another.
meanings.sent1: My friend couldn't attend the meeting, so I went as her proxy.
meanings.sent2: The proxy voted on behalf of the absent member during the election.
meanings.sent3: The proxy showed up at the party pretending to be my friend - what a mix-up!
meanings.sent4: In the play, the character served as a proxy for the king, making decisions in his absence.
meanings.sent5: The proxy, with a mask and a cape, symbolized the absent hero in the school play.

meanings.definition: The authority to represent someone else, especially in voting.
meanings.sent1: She held the proxy to cast votes on behalf of her elderly neighbor.
meanings.sent2: The shareholders granted their proxies to the board members for the annual meeting.
meanings.sent3: The proxy for the class president election accidentally voted for the wrong candidate!
meanings.sent4: The proxy's power to decide the fate of the company's future was a heavy responsibility.
meanings.sent5: With the proxy in hand, she confidently entered the voting booth to make her choice.

meanings.definition: A document giving someone the power to act for another.
meanings.sent1: Make sure to bring the proxy with you to the legal meeting.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer drafted a proxy to authorize the transfer of property on behalf of the client.
meanings.sent3: The proxy got lost in the pile of papers on the desk, causing a moment of panic.
meanings.sent4: The proxy, a piece of paper with immense authority, changed the course of the business deal.
meanings.sent5: With the signed proxy in hand, she was ready to make decisions on behalf of her sister.
